title: Restoration
html:
25 "I will turn my hand against you,

And smelt out your dross as with lye,

And remove all your slag:

26 I will restore your magistrates as of old,

And your counselors as of yore.

After that you shall be called

City of Righteousness, Faithful City."

27 Zion shall be saved in the judgment;

Her repentant ones, in the retribution. (NJV)

After purging the imperfections of her inhabitants, the Lord will restore Jerusalem as a righteous city with trustworthy leaders. And as promised in verse 27, he will save Zion with justice and the repentant converts with retribution (or righteousness, KJV). It will be a marvelous time when the Lord and his people (Zion, or the pure in heart) will be established in judgment and righteousness upon the earth. It will be a time of peace and joy for many, though some will instead suffer the consequences described by Isaiah in the last verses of chapter 1.
